Event.0: The Cleveland Cavaliers, led by star LeBron James, defeated the Golden State Warriors in a thrilling game seven to claim the franchise's first NBA title.
Event.1: Pixar's animated film "Inside Out" is released with voices by Amy Poehler, Phyllis Smith, Lewis Black, Bill Hader and Mindy Kaling
Event.2: American actor James Gandolfini, who was best known for his portrayal of Mafia boss and family man Tony Soprano in the HBO drama series The Sopranos (1999–2007), died of a heart attack while vacationing in Rome.
Event.3: Backup dancer Dean Sheremet (29) divorces Grammy Award-winning singer LeAnn Rimes (27) after nearly eight years of marriage
Event.4: "Malcolm in the Middle" actress Jane Kaczmarek (53) divorces actor Bradley Whitford (49) after 16 years of marriage
Event.5: Colombian drug lord Pablo Escobar surrenders to police
Event.6:
Dirk Nowitzki
German basketball player
was born
Event.7: Soviet cosmonaut Valentina V. Tereshkova, the first woman to travel in space, returned to Earth in the spacecraft Vostok 6.
Event.9: Loretta Lynn records "I'm a Honky Tonk Girl"
Event.10:
Rosenbergs executed for espionage
After the failure of court appeals and of a worldwide campaign for mercy, husband and wife Julius and Ethel Rosenberg were put to death this day in 1953, becoming the first American civilians to be executed for espionage.
Event.11:
Ayman al-Zawahiri
Egyptian militant
was born
Event.12:
Salman Rushdie
British writer
was born
Event.13: World War II: First day of the 2 day Battle of the Philippine Sea, US naval forces defeat Japanese fleet
Event.14: During World War II the Japanese Combined Fleet and the U.S. Fifth Fleet engaged in a major air-and-sea battle, the Battle of the Philippine Sea, which ended the next day with a U.S. victory.
Event.15: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC) was organized in the United States.
Event.16: Lou Gehrig (the “Iron Horse”), one of the most-durable players in American professional baseball and one of its great hitters, was born.
Event.17: American socialite Wallis Warfield—who became the wife of Prince Edward, duke of Windsor (Edward VIII), after the latter abdicated the British throne in order to marry her—was born.
Event.18: The emperor of Mexico, Maximilian, was executed by a firing squad.
Event.19: With the arrival of Union soldiers in Galveston, Texas, the state's residents finally learned about the Emancipation Proclamation (1863); the day became the annual holiday known as Juneteenth, commemorating the end of slavery in the United States.
Event.21:
José Rizal
Filipino political leader and author
was born
Event.22: Swedish/Norwegian crown prince Charles weds Dutch princess Wilhelmina
Event.23: Alexander Joy Cartwright arranged a baseball game between the New York Knickerbockers and the New York Nine at Hoboken, New Jersey—the first baseball game to use the set of rules on which today's game is based.
Event.24: Philosopher Karl Marx (25) weds Jenny von Westphalen in Germany
Event.25: Sir Robert Peel introduces the Metropolitan Police Act 1829 into Parliament to establish a unified police force for London
Event.26:
James I
king of England and Scotland
was born
Event.27: Philip the Bold, Duke of Burgundy marries Margaret 111 Countess of Flanders
